tiddlers.title: $AutoImportHelp
tiddlers.text:
The [[$AutoImport]] tiddler contains a DataList of packages to import when TWiki first loads.

Each package contains tiddlers which are loaded in to memory. These tiddlers:

* may contain functionality or data
* can encapsulate things like themes or plugins
* may or may not be stored depending on flags applied when importing them

## What is a Package?
A package, at it's most basic is just a URL which returns a list of tiddlers. Technically a package is an object with at least one property `tiddlers` of type Array.

- In future a package will contain more metadata e.g. name, version, author etc.
- You will also be able to define update policies for packages e.g. if you want automatic updating of patches or minor updates

## Import Flags
You can specify options as to how tiddlers are auto-imported:

* `save`: Set the `save` flag to ensure imported tiddlers are stored locally when you save. The default is off so imported tiddlers are nor persisted. By default the `core` and `icons` packages are set to `save` so that you have basic functionality offline
* `force`: Set the `overwrite` flag to ensure the entire package is always imported even if this means overwriting tiddlers you may have changed. The default is off which means the auto-importer will prompt you about overwriting tiddlers you may have changed.
* `nooverwrite`: Set the `nooverwrite` flag if you plan to change imported tiddlers and don't want them overwritten. The auto-importer will just skip importing them if the tiddler exists

tiddlers.title: $GeneralSettings
$Website
Code Tiddler
tiddlers.text:
// This code tiddler is run as soon as Twiki is loaded/reloaded
console.log('Hello from the Code Tiddler!');

tiddlers.title: Concepts
tiddlers.text:
## Types of Tiddlers
The `type` field of a tiddler determines what it's content means and how it is displayed.

* System tiddlers:
  * In general tiddler titles beginning with `$` are considered SystemTiddlers and hidden by default.
  * Tiddlers tagged with *Shadow* are also hidden from normal searches
  * To view hidden tiddlers just prefix your search with `$`
* Rendering is based on the tiddler type:
  * `css`, `html/template` or `scripts/js` are displayed as code with highlighting
  * `x-twiki` or `markdown` are rendered as markdown and intended for reading
  *  `list`, `keyval` or `table` are rendered as markdown and intended for storing structured data
  * `json` is rendered as JSON and intended for storing data/objects
* Behaviour can be based on type or name:
  * Type:
    * Code tiddlers (`scripts/js`) are executed with eval() in the global context
  * Name:
    * The [[$Theme]] tiddler is a list of StyleSheets which are applied as CSS
    * The [[$AutoImport]] tiddler is a list of packages which are imported as tiddlers
    * The [[$TiddlerDisplay]] tiddler is an HTML template for customizing how tiddlers are displayed
  
* Shadow tiddlers are included in source, expected to be there and we cannot start without them
* Packages specified in [[$AutoImport]] are loaded from URLs when we start
  * Core: Adds basic useful functionality
  * Website: provides helpful content and functionality for the TWiki website
  * Onboarding: The onboarding package helps users learn TWiki
* Tiddlers imported via a package are not automatically saved to your localStorage when you save
  * If you edit and save them then they will be
  * Once you save them, they will not be overwritten from the package until you delete them

tiddlers.title: Features
tiddlers.text:
* Saving works out of the box
  * localStorage with Backup option via plugin
  * backup to or synch with [JSONBin](https://jsonbin.io/)
* Namespaces: Easily switch between different stores!
* List all tiddlers
  * [All Normal Tiddlers](#msg:ui.openAll)
  * [Really All (*) Tiddlers](#msg:ui.openAll:{title:'*',tag:'*'})
* Add, Edit, Close and Delete a tiddler
  * Double-Click to edit
  * Ctrl+Enter to save
  * [[$TrashedTiddlers]] saved not really deleted
* Rendering 
  * x-twiki and [CommonMark](#Markdown%20Test) markdown
  * Code highlighting ([js](#Code%20Tiddler), [css](#StyleSheet) and [html](#HTML%20Example))
* Open single or list of tiddlers via link
  * [‚≠êFavorties](#msg:ui.openAll:{tag:'Favorite'})
* Code/Plugin tiddlers
  * Tiddlers of type `script/js` are just executed (eval) in global context
  * Macros - e.g. to open/close all/selected tiddlers
    * `<<ShowAllTiddlersButton>>` <<ShowAllTiddlersButton>>
    * `<<CloseAllTiddlersButton>>` <<CloseAllTiddlersButton>>
* Theming
  * [[$Theme]] tiddler collects stylesheets
  * Stylesheets can be in one or more tiddlers
  * [[$DisplayTemplate]] tiddler determines display of tiddler
  * [[$TitleBar]] to customize the titlebar
  * `<<themes.apply khaki>>` <<themes.apply khaki>>
* Structured Data
  * Configurable lists or key-value pairs via `list` tiddlers
    * e.g. Tiddler types from [[$TiddlerTypes]] tiddler
  * Configuration objects via `json` tiddlers
    * e.g. Backup settings for [[Backup2JSONBinPlugin]]
* Packages
  * Import tiddlers from a list of packages in [[$AutoImport]] ‚úÖ
  * Import tiddlers from any URL

## Other/Tech
* Basic pub/sub events ‚úÖ
* Vanilla JS, no complicated framework

tiddlers.title: Help
tiddlers.text:
## Searching
* To search hidden tiddlers type `$` followed by your search query
* To search by tag type `$tag:Styling`

tiddlers.title: Welcome
tiddlers.text:
# Welcome

TWiki is, like TiddlyWiki, a cool way to manage semi-structured information with the core concept being "code is data". [[Features]]

## Introduction
With TWiki everything is in the database including code meaning that the information platform is also the development environment.

When you create a new "entry" it can be data (like a note) or code which actually runs - so installing a plugin means, in practice, adding a new entry.


---
NOTE: This tiddler is part of the package `website`.
* Click [here](#msg:search:$pck:website) to view all tiddlers it imports.
* Checkout the [[$AutoImportHelp]] for more details on how packages are imported.
